briefTitle: CHIZAP: Community- and Health Facility-Based Intervention With Zinc as Adjuvant Therapy for Childhood Pneumonia

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Pneumonia: Child presenting with cough or difficult breathing and elevated respiratory rate.
* Severe pneumonia: Child presenting with cough or difficult breathing and chest indrawing , but without any of the following danger signs:

  * not able to drink/breastfeed,
  * vomit everything,
  * has had convulsions,
  * is lethargic or unconscious.
* Must be able to take Zinc

Exclusion Criteria:

* The child requires special care for severe illness other than pneumonia
* Severe malnutrition defined as being \< 70% National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) median weight for height
* Presence of congenital heart disease
* Documented tuberculosis
* Any antibiotic treatment during the last 48 hours
* The child was enrolled less than 6 months ago
* Presence of dysentery
* Cough for more than 14 days

outcomeMeasures.title: Risk of Treatment Failure.
outcomeMeasures.description: Enrolled children will be followed and given zinc or placebo for 14 days. We will compare the proportion with treatment failure (i.e. lack of improvement within 3 days) between the two groups

outcomeMeasures.title: Non-injury Clinic Visits and Hospital Admissions After Treatment Has Been Initiated
outcomeMeasures.description: We will measure to what extent the intervention can reduce the number of severe events.

outcomeMeasures.title: Active and Passive Morbidity Surveillance for Six Months After the 14-day Supplementation Period is Completed
outcomeMeasures.description: We will measure to what extent short term zinc administration has an impact on growth and morbidity for up to 6 months after end of supplementation

outcomeMeasures.title: Difference in Growth and Thymic Size Between the Treatment Groups Measured at Three and Six Months After the Zinc Supplementation
outcomeMeasures.description: Thymus size will be measured using ultrasonography and compared between the two groups. at two occasions 2.5 and 6 months after end of supplementation

outcomeMeasures.title: Adverse Effects
outcomeMeasures.description: Vomiting, regurgitation, pain in abdomen for 15 minutes after zinc or placebo administration.

outcomeMeasures.title: Effect Modifiers for the Effect of Zinc Given During Pneumonia
outcomeMeasures.description: We will also measure of there are factors at baseline that modifies the effect of zinc. Whether the following are modifiers for the above-mentioned effect of zinc given during pneumonia: i.severe inflammation, reflected in: high fever and/or elevated plasma C-reactive protein (CRP) concentration

outcomeMeasures.title: The Efficacy of Zinc According to Breast Feeding Status and in Different Age Categories
outcomeMeasures.description: We will measure to what extent breastfeeding status modifies the effect of zinc on pneumonia

outcomeMeasures.title: The Efficacy of Zinc in Malnourished and Non-malnourished Children
outcomeMeasures.description: We will compare the efficacy of zinc in those that are stunted, wasted or underweight with those who are not.

outcomeMeasures.title: Will Presence of a RNA Virus Modify the Effect of Zinc
outcomeMeasures.description: We will compare the efficacy of zinc according to virus detected in nasopharyngeal secretions

outcomeMeasures.title: Folate, Cobalamin and Vitamin D Status of the Enrolled Children
outcomeMeasures.description: And whether or not these vitamins predict treatment failure and duration of illness.
